content: Do we have a policy on whether internal-to-norm_num lemmas need a deprecation notice? I lean to no, but wanted to check first.
Perhaps @Mario Carneiro already has an opinion on that, having both written many tactics but also I think expressed opposition to private in the past.
IMO, deprecations are cheap, so why not add them. Probably "use norm_num" works as the alternative

Do we have a way to have deprecations that don't result in deletions? I agree that people should not be using norm_num lemmas just because they happen to have the same shape as add_comm or something. I think these uses are almost always mistakes introduced by exact? and I would like them to be blacklisted for that purpose
I don't think they should be private or have inaccessible names, this makes it harder to roundtrip lemmas via #print (which is a useful debugging technique)
and once modules come around I think it will not meet the module-aware definition of private since they still need to be referred to by the tactic
But not sure if exact? checks for deprecations
